name: tired pixels #3
description:
The lights flickered with the color of generations
When it snowed, everyone froze for a moment  
Goodbye forever, Saturday said to Friday
The lights went out, the snow melted, people went hunting
Where under the bridge by the surface of the waters
Merged all into a violent round dance
Under the mud of the spray, hiding up the head
Blown away by the wind, I walked home across the bridge
Holding on to the handrails I saw in the distance
The light of the stained-glass windows floated along the river
At the entrance on the steps of the temple
A panorama flowed over the slabs of life
Inside where the tomb was
Stood parishioners  covering their faces
Knocks of Anvils of  poured from the walls
And only the one who was passed out did not groan
Under the dark vault of candles rotation 
Contraction opened up the riot of flesh
And in the corners teeth sparked  bleeding poison
There where  is from the pipes of the organa smell sharp  
Crimson cloth hangs on a broken fresco
Smoke blurs the outlines of bodies
The order of strength begins to weight
Breaking the chains of the pulse from the heart
I left the temple holding the door
I was walking for a moment now with snow
And generations light has spread to me like escape
